element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm creates a Delaunay triangulation from a set of points.
The Delaunay triangulation of a point set is a collection of edges satisfying an "empty circle" property: for each edge we can find a circle containing the edge's endpoints but not containing any other points.
The Delaunay triangulation is closely related to the Voronoi tesselation. Connecting the center of the circumcircles in the Delaunay triangulation produces the Voronoi tesselation.

element.name: POINTS
element.text: The layer with the points to triangulate.

element.name: TRIANGLES
element.text: The layer with the resulting triangulation. Each triangle just has an ID in its attributes table. Attributes from the input layer are not preserved.
